headline: Is Rising Short Interest Reframing Hewlett Packard Enterprise’s (HPE) Capital Intensity And Competitive Positioning?
summary: In recent days, Hewlett Packard Enterprise reported that shares sold short rose by 27.47%, reaching 68.07 million shares, or 5.8% of its float, even though this remains below the 9.98% peer-group average. This sharp acceleration in short interest comes as HPE contends with slower historical revenue growth and a weaker free cash flow margin, highlighting growing investor focus on its competitive and capital intensity challenges. We’ll now examine how this rapid increase in short interest fits...

headline: A Look At Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Valuation After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: Event context and recent share performance Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) shares have been under pressure recently, with the stock showing a 1 day return of a 1.83% decline and a past week return of an 8.33% decline. This sets the backdrop for investors assessing current levels. See our latest analysis for Hewlett Packard Enterprise. That short term share price weakness, including the 11.10% 30 day share price return and 8.90% year to date share price return, sits against a 5 year total...
